item.title: Current Mortgage Rates: September 18, 2025
item.description: Freddie Mac's rate for a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage averaged 6.26% for the week ending September 18, its lowest level in nearly a year.

item.title: When Is the Next Fed Meeting, and Will We See Another Rate Cut?
item.description: How the Fed navigates continued political pressure will have real-world consequences, influencing everything from mortgage rates and credit card costs...

item.title: The Average Credit Score Just Fell at Fastest Pace Since the Great Recession
item.description: The average credit score for all U.S. consumers is now 715.

item.title: From Loans to Jobs, Here’s How the Fed Rate Cut May Affect Your Wallet
item.description: Here's what to know if you're borrowing money, saving money, buying a house, selling a house, retired, invested in the stock market and more.

item.title: How Small Businesses Are Navigating Economic Uncertainty
item.description: Across industries, strong-willed entrepreneurs are taking calculated risks to turn today’s uncertainty into tomorrow’s growth.
